answers.answer: Goodmorning Ladies,I was wondering if any of you moms have ever experienced night terrors with any of your children. My son who is eight has suffered from them since the end of January. They started when he came down with fifth disease (actually we all had the disease what a horrible illness). He wakes up exactly one hour after he has been asleep he then begins to jump around, waving his arms and sometimes he's even crying. You can't reason with him we just have to wait it out. This goes on every night, I have spoken to the dr, about it but they don't seem to worried about it they say that some children do it especially after a illness associated with high fevers. I just want some advice I feel so bad for him it must interupt his sleep so that his not getting all that he needs. Let me knowCinnamonheart-Do you live in Ontario New York or Ontario Canada? We live in Rochester NY.
Good luck on that ultrasound today girly! Let us know how big that baby is!!!!!! Danielle

Just wanted to let everyone know that I have a new nephew. He was born yesterday. He weighed 6.6. She went to the doctor Friday for her 36 wks check and was dilated to 3 so they put her in yesterday to induce. She could not have a epidural (spelling? sorry) because of something to do with her or the baby's protein. Does anyone know anything about that.But the baby is doing just fine from what I could get out of my husband. He was in a wierd mood last night and trying to get info out of him last night was like pulling teeth.

Hey you guys! How are you all? I am having so much fun being a mommy. Alex is the best baby. He is almost always content and happy! He was 3 months Sunday. His latest things is talking. He is such a talker. He talks all the time, even when he is upset. It is so cute. I love it. He also is always trying to stuff both of his hands in his mouth.I started weight watchers last week and today is my second weight in. I hope I have lost some weight.Mandi

mamabear--Ontario Canada is where I amstill a mom--Oh your little one has found his fingers and mouth  they will now never be out of there!! I know Cody can almost shove his whole hand in there.  I think the most favourtie time of baby hood for me is about 3-6 months  they , talk(but doesnt make sense) they smile, they recognize you,they stay in ONE PLACE

Ok I am jealous of your GOOD babies.  I am ready to pull my hair out with mine.  He is getting to the point now that is SOMEONE IS NOT holding him he is screaming.  I have things to do and CANNOT hold him all damn day.  I love him to peices but I cannot get housework done he will not lay down to sleep I have to hold him I cannot shower.  I do not know what else to do.  I have been letting him cry but it breaks my heart not to mention it is driving me crazy to have to listen to it.  I have said it before and I will say it again...I feel bad feeling this way.  So many women are trying to have babies and I am complaining about mine.  I had a m/c before him and I am so thankful to have him but OMG a person can only take so much.  My DD is on Spring Break this week as well and is also driving me nuts.  I need a vacation - just me & DH would be nice but NO KIDS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Well I better go I got to finish cleaning up and I think I am going to take DD to the park for a while today.  It is going to be almost 80 degrees.  That is the ONLY thing keeping me sane.   Take Care

I think ds is pretty smart, he yells mom gives in (I know i do to)  Cody isnt too to bad unless he is tired, but its got to start from the start. My dd (10) always is picking him up and I tell her to get away from him!!  She says he is too cute. Yeah cute for 5 mins then she is handing him off to me!!  I say he is fine LEAVE HIM ALONE   but the little buggers catch on  sometimes I think we should be kangaroo's so we can have a pouch
Let us know how you make out were you going to find out the sex? If we dont hear from you .....Ill assume you took drastic measure while there to  have this little one

My son was a bit like that until I discovered the bouncy chair, (I did not want to get a sling and make him reliant on me 24/7 in the house, I'd seen friend with that one!) as long as he is safe, he should be fine, I used to drag him around with me everywhere, in the bathroom, in the kitchen, keeping up a constant dialogue with him all the time, making a noise, not picking him up but letting him know there were times when I just needed to get on.  Howled for about two or three times, then, once he sussed on I wasn't going to pick him up, (whilst doing my bits, housework, cleaning,bathing etc) soon settled, also I chose a time when he wasn't howling to take him out of the chair, which gave him the notion that it wasn't his crying that made me pick him up out of his bouncy chair, merely that it was cuddle time/feed time, change time, play time etc.  Took a while but he was fine afterwards. 3 or 4 months at the time I think, can't really remember as he is 10 now!

Now that your planning to build, are you and dh agreeing on the plans? We are just rebuilding and renovating the kitchen and we cant agree on anything!!! He wants a island in the kitchen I dont, we have a nice oak table so I dont figure we need to sit at  an island on a bar stool to eat....  I think I will be crazy before we get plans made or even started.

oK I really really really think my 2month old is teething.  I know a lot of you swear by Hyland's teething tablets but I have heard they are lactose based adn my little girl has lactose issues...has anyone tried Humphrey's teething tablets???  They are supposed to be sugar based...HELP PLEASE!!!!

The only thing I can think of is perhaps the mother had protein in her urine, which can be a sign of toxemia or pre-eclampsia.  If someone had that, some places may not give them an epidural. But most would, anyway.Why was she induced at only 36 weeks?  The fact that she was makes me think that something else was going on--you don't get induced so early just for being dilated.Hope that helps!

Well she did have preeclampsia.  they were at one time talking about taking the baby at 32 weeks but she was able to hold out until 36 weeks. Well they are in Judsonia, Arkansas so I don't know how the doctors are down there. Thank you for your response

I think my little guy just needed some outdoor time.  I took him and DD to the park and I put him in a little swing and he LOVED it.  He laughed because his tummy bubbled from going back and forth.  I was loving it.  He came home, nursed a little and I was able to lay him down for a nap.  I am so excited.  I guess he is going to be an outdoor baby.  Summer can arrive now. LOL!!!!!!!!!!!!

NO!!!!!!  I do not think we are going to agree.  I have expensive taste on a not so expensive budjet.  I want a bonus room above the garage DH says we do not have the money and we do not need it.  I NEED IT.  I want it for my scrapbooking room and a nice little mommy get away.  I want to find a way to afford it.  We are now racking our brains trying to find something we can rent short term.  Noone likes to do that.  OMG!!!!!  Give me a break they are going to get our money so what does it matter.  O well.  The stress is going to kill me.  DH won't get on the ball and sit with me and decide on what plan we want and what colors we want.  I want this done before the start of next school year if possible he has to get off of his rump and do this with me.  I have been a real bear towards my kids because of this also.  Hopefully it will all fall into place soon.PS> I would go with the island also.   I love counterspace.  Sorry :o)

Has anyone heard from Buckeye lately? Last I remember hearing from her was about 1 1/2 months ago and she said she was have twins. How is she doing? I know she lost twin boys and had trouble getting pregnant, so I wanted to know how her and her babies were doing.mandi

My friend is 25 weeks pregnant with g/b twins.  I just found out that she has been put into hospital because they want to come out now!!!  The doctors have told her that she has to hold on for 9 weeks! I just hope everything goes well.  Would the babies have a chance if they were born before the 9 weeks is up?

I think they would have a chance.  I am not sure about twins though.  I think a single pg would have a better chance if born at 25 wks.  I will keep her in my prayers.  Hopefully all works out.  Wish her luck and take care.
I know you will probably know the answer to my question I ask in my post above. So if you could look at my post above to see if you can answer. Thank you

My sister is having twins  she is about 28 weeks, yes they want them to be 34 weeks, I guess twins do come earlier as a rule.She better stay on bed rest. I know when i had my first baby a girl had a set of twins they weighed 1lb 4 0z each. Does your friend know the weight of the babies?? I met another lady who baby was 2 lb 8 0z and survived. - one post here had a baby around 1lb 11 0zHope all goes well.

My son went through a phase where he would freak out crying and screaming if I put him down. I agree that the bouncy chair is a great thing-- and he loved the exersaucer too! Some days, however, I did carry him around the house in the Snugli-- doing the dishes and laundry, etc with him strapped to my stomach!(not really helpful for your shower problem, though!) Luckily he outgrew that phase after a short while.  If he likes the bouncy chair or saucer, just place it beside the shower/tub and enjoy a few minutes of hot water!  I also used to put the saucer in front of the TV with a Baby Einstein video on-- he was so captivated he forgot to cry!

question: Hi girls--  Hope you have a great day Its actually nice here in ontario, and the snow is all gone!!Its meet the teacher night tonight --ahhh
title: ````````Tuesday Open Forum`````````````````
